Key Match Events: Jalen Johnson scored 29 points leading the Atlanta Hawks to a 126-111 victory over the New Orleans Pelicans.
Zion Williamson was scratched from the lineup with right hamstring tightness shortly before the game.
Brandon Ingram scored 32 points for the Pelicans.
Trae Young scored 23 points for the Hawks.
Former Pelican Dyson Daniels, back from a two-game injury absence, added 16 points for Atlanta.
Larry Nance Jr. scored 14 points against his former team.
The Hawks pulled away for good with a 14-0 run in the middle of the fourth quarter that made it 116-97.
David Roddy ignited the 14-0 run with a 3-pointer and Jalen Johnson had three dunks during the spurt.
The Pelicans were outscored 66-32 in the paint.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Hawks snapped a four-game skid with this victory.
New Orleans was without starters Dejounte Murray, CJ McCollum, and Herb Jones, along with prominent reserve Trey Murphy III.
The Hawks played without starter De’Andre Hunter, plus rotation players Bogdan Bogdanovic, Vit Krejci and Kobe Bufkin due to injury.
